Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk ipa-admintools
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: ipa bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: Red Hat Identity Management (IdM) is a centralized authentication, identity management, and authorization solution for both traditional and cloud-based enterprise environments. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the caIPAserviceCert profile was replaced with an incorrect version during replica installation. The profile import procedure, which is executed during every replica installation, has been modified to never replace existing profiles. Now, replica installation no longer replaces caIPAserviceCert with an incorrect version of the certificate profile. (BZ#1337820) When installing a clone certificate authority (CA) on a replica, the LDAP entry representing the replica was marked with the "caRenewalMaster" flag, even though another server already served as the CA renewal master. However, Identity Management (IdM) supports only one CA renewal master. Consequently, generating a new CA subsystem certificate could potentially cause the certificate to be generated multiple times, and CA operations, such as certificate renewal, could stop working on some servers. Now, the replica is no longer marked as "caRenewalMaster" in the described situation. Also, IdM removes any surplus "caRenewalMaster" flags to ensure only one CA renewal master is available. As a result, generating a CA subsystem certificate does not cause the CA operations to fail. (BZ#1339304) Users of ipa are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
